plugins.name: Multiple Wrapper
plugins.description:
Sometimes you need to wrap elements inside several frames or groups, and regular methods are not enough for this. That is why this plugin was created. It can wrap selected elements together or wrap each of selected as frames or auto layouts, and also it can change selected frames or groups to auto layouts


FEATURES

‚Üí It works similar to Figma's grouping capabilities

‚Üí Wrap together selected child elements individually based on parent

‚Üí Wrap each selected element individually

‚Üí Wrap selected elements as groups, frames or auto layouts

‚Üí Changing group or frame to autolayout

‚Üí Supports auto layout wrap feature of figma


‚ö†Ô∏è Plugin doesnt work with sections (except for wrapping in a group), childs of component set and childs of instances. If you try to run it with these selected components, then nothing will happen


- You can try this plugin in the playground by clicking on the "Try it out" button


Do you like this plugin? I would be very grateful for your support - Buy me a coffee ‚òï

üíª - GitHub

üìß - denis.solovey.design@gmail.com

plugins.name: Selection Mark
plugins.description:
Selection Mark (Blue)


Create rectangles around selections.


Use a keyboard shortcut, or select "Selection Mark" from your plugins menu (or just type it on cmd bar CMD+/) and that's it! you made a selection mark!


How to add a keyboard shortcut (Mac)?

  1. Go to System Preferences
  2. Search for Keyboard
  3. Click on Shortcuts tab
  4. Search for "App Shortcuts"
  5. Add Figma.app
  6. Click on the + and Type in: "Selection Mark"
  7. Chose your shortcut by typing for example: CMD+Option+Shift+[
  8. That's it!


Enjoy!


(I made this plugin for my own use, but why not to share it?)

plugins.name: locize
plugins.description:
What is locize?

Ôªø

locize is a new online service that offers true continuous localization. The translations are managed in your locize project and published from there to the locize CDN to be consumed from your application. The localization team can take care of the translations from the first day and keep up with changes with ease. The processes are separated. Translations can be updated without the need to release an update of your app. locize is bridging the gap between translation and development!


Best for


All involved in the software localization process: Developers, Designers, Team Leads, Heads of Engineering, Translation/Localization team, Product Managers, Project Leaders, Marketing, etc...

 

For more information please visit: https://locize.com

 

Why connect locize and Figma?

 

Bridging the gap between translation and design with locize, a modern and affordable localization-management-platform. It makes your website, app, game or whatever your project is, global, vibrant, and more engaging especially when unleashing the continuous localization capabilities.


Pushing texts from Figma to locize. Send first text content from within Figma to locize in seconds so that your Translators can start their work right away.

 

Try your designs in a different language by fetching other translations directly into Figma. Preview your designs in all your languages before handoff to Developers.

 

Increase your overall translation quality and reduce feedback loops.


How to set up

For more information and to learn how to install the plugin visit https://docs.locize.com/more/figma-plugin

Don‚Äôt have a locize account? Try it for free! https://www.locize.app/register

accepted.name: locize
accepted.description: The pay-per-use continuous localization management platform. Bridging the gap between translation and development.

plugins.tagline: Bridge Design and Translation Seamlessly with locize for Figma

plugins.name: Locksmith
plugins.description:
Locksmith plugin allows you to lock and unlock layers quickly and easily in Figma and FigJam.


How it works:

1. Select layers to lock: Simply select the layers you want to lock or unlock. You can also lock all layers on a page with a single click.

2. Unlocking: Once you're done with your annotations or design tasks, you can unlock all layers at once, making it easy to return to your normal workflow.

3. Legacy layers: When unlocking, you have the option to include layers that were manually locked before, providing more flexibility.


Features:

‚Ä¢ Bulk lock/unlock: Lock or unlock all layers on a page with a single click, saving time and effort compared to locking/unlocking layers one by one.

‚Ä¢ Flexibility: Choose whether to unlock only the layers you locked with Locksmith, or include legacy layers that were locked manually.

‚Ä¢ Works seamlessly with auto-layout: Prevents layers from shifting while annotating or working on designs.


Tips:

‚Ä¢ Use Locksmith to lock layers while working with annotations or adjustments to prevent accidental movement.

‚Ä¢ After completing your annotations, unlock all layers with one click to continue your design process without manual effort.

‚Ä¢ Locksmith is useful for both Figma and FigJam, making it versatile for different types of design workflows.


Let me know if you'd like any more adjustments! Find me at https://linkedin.com/in/vaigu
plugins.tagline: Lock/ unlock multiple layers at once

plugins.name: Text Updater
plugins.description:
Automatically update text changes and match styles.

----
When copy and paste text in & out Figma, most of the time we can get plain text. While it is fine to communicate with others and edit in different apps, we lose all our styles.

This plugin uses Google's "diff-match-patch" algorithm to track text diffs and match text styles, so that you don't have to read the text word by word and update them painfully.

-----
Known Issues: 
‚Ä¢ works best when update amount is not overwhelming.
‚Ä¢ emojis and SF Symbols could cause bugs of figma.

plugins.name: Paletto - oklch palette generator
plugins.description:
Introducing our Figma plugin designed to revolutionize your design process with seamless, consistent color palettes generated directly from your chosen HEX code. This innovative tool is engineered to accept a HEX code along with a list of lightness values, meticulously crafting a pure, balanced, and harmonious palette that integrates effortlessly into your projects.


Key Features:


  • HEX Code Input: Start with your favorite HEX color as the foundation of your palette, ensuring personalized and unique designs.
  • Custom Lightness Values: Tailor your palette with a range of lightness options, allowing for versatile and dynamic color schemes.
  • Consistent Color Palettes: Achieve a cohesive look across your designs with palettes that are clean, aligned, and consistent.
  • Effortless Integration: Seamlessly incorporate generated palettes into your Figma projects, enhancing productivity and creativity.


Whether you're refining the visual identity of a brand, crafting user interfaces, or developing digital illustrations, our plugin streamlines your workflow, offering an intuitive solution for creating the perfect color palette every time. Embrace the power of color consistency and elevate your design with just a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Generate consistent color palettes from your favorite HEX

plugins.name: 4x Perfect
plugins.description:
With a single click, it adjusts the size and position of all elements to the nearest multiple of four, helping to enhance the consistency and precision of your designs.


Key Features

Automatic Precision Alignment: If an element‚Äôs size is not a multiple of four, it is adjusted to the nearest multiple. For example, elements with a width or height of 7 are adjusted to 8, and those at 5 are adjusted to 4.

Decimal Handling: Sizes including decimals are rounded to the nearest multiple of four. For example, 9.1 becomes 8.

Auto Layout Preservation: The size of elements set to 'Auto' remains unchanged, preserving the flexibility of your designs.

Exact Positioning: The x and y positions of elements are rounded to eliminate decimals, ensuring perfect pixel alignment.


How to Use

Adjust Individual Elements: Select a specific element and run the plugin to automatically adjust all sub-elements within it.

Adjust Entire Page: Running the plugin without selecting any elements will automatically adjust all elements on the current page.

Multilingual Support:

supports English, Korean, Japanese, and Chinese, making it accessible to a global user base.

plugins.tagline: With just one click, align all elements  within the UI to multiples of four

106888.name: 4x Perfect
106888.description:
With a single click, it adjusts the size and position of all elements to the nearest multiple of four, helping to enhance the consistency and precision of your designs.


Key Features

Automatic Precision Alignment: If an element‚Äôs size is not a multiple of four, it is adjusted to the nearest multiple. For example, elements with a width or height of 7 are adjusted to 8, and those at 5 are adjusted to 4.

Decimal Handling: Sizes including decimals are rounded to the nearest multiple of four. For example, 9.1 becomes 8.

Auto Layout Preservation: The size of elements set to 'Auto' remains unchanged, preserving the flexibility of your designs.

Exact Positioning: The x and y positions of elements are rounded to eliminate decimals, ensuring perfect pixel alignment.


How to Use

Adjust Individual Elements: Select a specific element and run the plugin to automatically adjust all sub-elements within it.

Adjust Entire Page: Running the plugin without selecting any elements will automatically adjust all elements on the current page.

Multilingual Support:

supports English, Korean, Japanese, and Chinese, making it accessible to a global user base.

plugins.name: Slot Editor
plugins.description:
Much like how components work on the web, Slot Editor lets you make any content within a component a slot, allowing you to make changes without effecting other instances.


Making a slot


  1. To make a slot, select one or more objects within a component.
  2. Run the plugin command Make Slot. This will turn the content into an instance.


Editing a slot


  1. Select one or more slots or instances with slots
  2. Run the plugin command Edit Slot. This will make all slots editable in place.
  3. When you're done making changes, click Done in the notification below.


Alternatively you can edit any slot by selecting an instance or slot and clicking Edit Slot from the the Properties Panel.


Removing a slot


  1. Select one or more objects with slots within them.
  2. Run the plugin command Remove Slot. This will not remove the object itself.


The plugin won't remove nested slots. To remove these, run command again until there are no slots left.


Things to know


When you select any content inside a component and make it into a slot the plugin replaces it with an instance of that content. It first creates a component with the content inside, then replaces that with an instance of that component.


When you edit a slot it creates a unique instance of the content inside that slot. Any changes you make will be private to that instance.


Because of this you should be aware that if you make changes to the contents of slots inside a component, they will not be reflected in any instances created from that component (unless they haven't been edited). For this reason, it is best to make a placeholder for your slot, rather than turn existing content into a slot.


If you delete a slot from a component, it will remove the respective slot from any instances that were using that slot.

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.tagline: Make re-usable components that you can slot modular content into

plugins.name: Team Library Component Attacher
plugins.description:
Provides to replace the frames with Team Library Component(Design System).


What It can help...

- Recover components which lost any links.

 - when you move your frames to another file.

 - when imported a Sketch file.

- Replace your frames with the component which belongs to Team Library.


How to Use

0. Make sure the target Frame, Group and Instance name and Team Library component name are same.

 - NOTE: Set the child component name when you use Variants.

1. Open your Team Library file and run Save master components.

2. Choose the target Frames, Groups, Instances then run Replace all selections with saved master components.


Known issues & Feature requests

üößAny text and other properties will be lost when replace them with instances.

https://github.com/rei-suzuki/figma-team-component-attacher/issues


Welcome your contributions!

plugins.name: Mezze ‚Äì Convert and Export Icons as React Components
plugins.description:
It's a chore keeping icons updated cross-functionally. Mezze allows you to convert and export icons as React components, and pushes changes directly to your Git repos.


See Mezze in action üé¨


‚ö° Benefits:

  1. Designers no longer have to export icons from Figma every time there are changes or additions.
  2. Devs save time creating React icon components, copying-and-pasting SVG code, and manually exposing props to parent components.
  3. Designers and devs can cross-reference an icon in production directly from Figma via Mezze Inspect.
  4. Component names in Figma match those in React, preventing duplicate icons from being added to the codebase.
  5. Unified React props across all icons.


üöÄ 10 Minute Set-Up:

  1. Generate a GitHub fine-grained Personal Access Token with the "Contents" repository permission set to "Read and write".
  2. If using Bitbucket, generate a Repository Access Token with the repository:write permission.
  3. If using GitLab, generate a Personal Access Token with the api scope.
  4. Install Mezze and open the plugin
  5. Head over to the "Settings" tab, enter the Access Token created above, and enter the Github/Bitbucket/GitLab repo owner/organization name.
  6. Save your settings and return to the Inspect tab.
  7. Select icons you wish to export. Icons must be Figma Components or Instances. Mezze Lite allows you to export up to 5 icons at a time, while Mezze Pro has no export limit.
  8. Icons will be added to a new GitHub branch. In the Export menu, you'll be able to enter the repo, icon directory, branch name, as well as a commit message for your changes.


üíñ Love Mezze? Let us know so we can keep improving your time here on Figma.

  1. Give Mezze a Like
  2. Drop a comment below
  3. Share


Benefits of Mezze Pro

  1. No export limit (up to 5MB of icons at a time)
  2. Attribute replacement config (e.g., changing SVG stroke color from #000 to currentColor)
plugins.tagline: Sync icon components in Figma to React components in GitHub/Bitbucket/GitLab

plugins.name: Jumpback
plugins.description:
Save your spot anywhere within your file then with a click of a button you can Jumpback.


STEP-BY-STEP

1. SAVE Current Spot

2. JUMP to Saved Spot

3. CLEAR Saved Spot (to make way for a new one)


USE CASE EXAMPLE

Joe is working on the latest update to the home screen for an app. He sees Jenny‚Äôs cursor come over, ‚ÄúHey Joe, come take a look at something.‚ÄùJoe wants to help her out, so he follows her over where she‚Äôs been doing updates on the Settings screen. He spends 10 minutes giving his feedback, but now he's ready to get back over to where he was working.The problem is, there‚Äôs multiple pages in this file, and 100+ screens... where was he?! Jumpback

 plugin to the rescue!


This plugin was built with love by the @unfold team - check out our other plugins and what we do!

plugins.name: HWB: Color Picker (Hue, White, Black)
plugins.description:
While RGB and CMYK may be the usual go-tos, the HWB color picker offers a unique approach that's particularly intuitive for artists and designers who think in terms of light and shadow. Let's explore its captivating world!


HWB stands for Hue, Whiteness, and Blackness, and here's how it works:

Hue: This is the base color, just like in HSL. Envision it as selecting a shade from the rainbow wheel, from fiery reds to serene blues.


Whiteness: It's like adding a touch of sunlight to your hue. Imagine blending your color with pure white to create softer, more luminous tones.


Blackness: Picture infusing a hint of shadow. This slider lets you mix in black, crafting more subdued, dramatic hues.

plugins.name: Scrim That
plugins.description:
Quickly add a scrim over a selected layer with Scrim That.


Want to create a scrim over your design to overlay a dialog box? But hate having to resize the scrim to match the width, height and correct layer position?


Scrim That has you covered with one-click magic scrimming.


Usage

Select a frame, group or shape layer and run the plugin to create the scrim over it.

Then tweak the styling of the layer as desired.


Open Source

Scrim That is open source, and contributions are most welcome.

accepted.name: Aashrey Sharma
accepted.description: Senior UX Designer @ Epic Games

plugins.name: Randator - Random name, number, email
plugins.description:
Randator: Your Ultimate Random Data Generator for Figma


Randator seamlessly integrates with your Figma workflow, allowing you to quickly populate text layers with random data. Simply select your text layers, choose your data type, and let Randator work its magic. With options to specify continents, countries, and data formats, you have full control over the generated content.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Random Names: Generate full names, first names, or last names from various cultures and regions.

‚Ä¢ Phone Numbers: Create authentic-looking phone numbers with optional country codes.

‚Ä¢ Email Addresses: Populate your designs with believable email addresses.

‚Ä¢ Usernames: Add a touch of realism with randomly generated usernames.

‚Ä¢ Custom Numbers: Generate random numbers with specific digit lengths for any numeric need.

plugins.name: Cropink Design Tools
plugins.description:
Ads with your Products Data. Automatically.

Cropink.com allows you to adapt product images from your ecommerce shop to any template using your product data.


Craft DPA Designs with Data from Your Product Feed

Harness the power of Meta's catalog data to craft unique dynamic product ads. Effortlessly integrate and align design elements like text and images with Meta's extensive product fields. Stay current, stay customized, and effortlessly elevate your brand presence.


Custom designs with dynamic data magic

Make it happen with direct Figma-Cropink linking, sophisticated style and element mapping, real-time previews, customizable templates, and advanced image fitting capabilities surpassing Figma's native options.


Cropink Design Tools Features:

  1. Connect Cropink to Figma - Get two-way integration between Figma designs and Cropink projects.
  2. Styles Mapping - Align custom design elements with Cropink swappable styles.
  3. Design Elements Mapping - Map Figma texts and images to prices, titles, and other product parameters.
  4. Product Data Always Fit - Figma auto layout and truncate support.
  5. Preview - See directly in Figma how your mapped design looks with your connected data.
  6. Templates - Use Cropink templates as a starting point for your custom designs.

plugins.name: Mode Inspector (Beta)
plugins.description:
üì¢ Request for feedback!

Hi all! This is a very simple Dev Mode only plugin that I built to help a very simple use case around showing translations stored in other variable modes.


I'm really keen to add more to it but to do that I'll need you to give direction around other things functionality you'd like the tool to have.


Please leave a comment or fill out this feedback form if you have any suggestions!


Plugin Description

Fairly lightweight plugin that allows developers to see variable values in different modes, without needing edit access, and without needing designers to duplicate every piece of UI just so they can extract data.


This is especially useful for things like translation, if you have a need to pull out strings one by one.


Note: This is currently in Beta and only supports string variables at the moment. If you have another need, or any feedback on how it currently works, please let me know!

accepted.name: Baffour Atuah
accepted.description: Designer, Developer, Candlestick Maker

plugins.name: JSON data
plugins.description:
This is an alpha release.


Forever free tool for checking the design on real world data. This is getting done by populating the file with JSON data prepared in advance in any text editor. Further updates might be aimed at getting the data from existing websites.


How to use:

  1. Define titles of the text layers.
  2. Create JSON-file in any text editor.
  3. Usage in Figma: select group with objects. Better to use the parent group.
  4. Insert the JSON content into the plugin text field.
  5. Click ‚ÄòApply JSON‚Äô button.


You can update data until you close the plugin.


How it works


Plugin searches for text field titles and populates them with JSON data if there is a match.


Some bugs are expected, plugin is provided AS IS, author is not to blame for any content loss.


TODO: hiding the layer on Null data received.
plugins.tagline: Plugin helps to populate dummy content with a production-ready content specified in JSON

plugins.name: Transez : AI Translator | Customizable Localization & 143 Languages for Seamless Design Translation
plugins.description:
Technical Edge


1. Real-Time Adaptive Translation

  1. Unlike rule-based tools, Transez learns from your design context. For example, translating "Submit" in a payment form? It automatically recognizes terms like (Credit Card) in adjacent layers to ensure consistency.

2. Dual AI Engines

  1. Translation Engine: GPT-4 fine-tuned for 50+ design scenarios (e.g., button labels, error messages, legal disclaimers).
  2. Creative Engine: Generate taglines, microcopy, or culturally resonant idioms on demand. Try prompts like "Make this slogan punchier for Gen Z audiences in Brazil."


Key Features


‚úÖ Intelligent Translation Modes

Page Translation: One-click bulk translation with layout auto-adjustment for RTL languages (e.g., Arabic, Hebrew).

Replacement Translation: Swap specific terms across all screens


‚úÖ 143 Languages with Dialect Support


Covers 98% of global internet users, including niche dialects like Cantonese , Algerian Arabic, and Mexican Spanish.


‚úÖ AI-Powered Creative Prompts


Beyond translation: Generate UX microcopy, marketing slogans, or even emoji recommendations based on cultural preferences.


‚úÖ Zero-Context Translation


Automatically infers design intent through layer hierarchy and component relationships. No manual notes needed for common scenarios.


Workflow Integration


1. Select Layers/Frames

2. Choose Mode & Language

3. Translate & Generate

4. Refine with AI Prompts


Why Transez Ôºü


‚ö°Ô∏è 50% Faster than manual translation + ChatGPT switching.


‚ö°Ô∏è 30% Fewer Revisions with design-aware AI.


‚ö°Ô∏è Creative Multiplier Turn translators into creative partners.


Target Users


For Designers: "Skip the back-and-forth with translators‚Äîget production-ready global texts in 1 clicks."

For PMs: "Launch localized MVP 48 hours faster without compromising quality."
plugins.tagline: Transez combines GPT-powered translation with AI-driven content generation,design  10x faster.

plugins.name: Trados Translation Connector for Figma
plugins.description:
You've got content to translate and you want to do it directly from Figma ‚Äì quickly, easily and efficiently. All it takes is to connect Figma to the world's most-used translation technology: Trados.


Trados is a next-generation translation platform that uses AI and other smart technologies to make localization processes more agile and secure. Businesses with global growth ambitions use Trados to streamline and automate their localization workflows, manage translation resources more effectively and securely, and improve brand consistency. Through Trados you can send content to any language service provider, in-house or external.


This Trados translation connector easily connects Figma to your Trados solution to create a seamless end-to-end process for localization. Users of Figma can then easily push content to Trados and receive the localized content back once translated. They have visibility of the whole process and control over the elements they need, including cost approval and review. It couldn't be simpler.

135243.name: Trados Translation Connector for Figma
135243.description:
You've got content to translate and you want to do it directly from Figma ‚Äì quickly, easily and efficiently. All it takes is to connect Figma to the world's most-used translation technology: Trados.


Trados is a next-generation translation platform that uses AI and other smart technologies to make localization processes more agile and secure. Businesses with global growth ambitions use Trados to streamline and automate their localization workflows, manage translation resources more effectively and securely, and improve brand consistency. Through Trados you can send content to any language service provider, in-house or external.


This Trados translation connector easily connects Figma to your Trados solution to create a seamless end-to-end process for localization. Users of Figma can then easily push content to Trados and receive the localized content back once translated. They have visibility of the whole process and control over the elements they need, including cost approval and review. It couldn't be simpler.
135243.release_notes:
1. Supports deletion of in progress projects if its enters a failed or error state.
2. Resolved preview-related bugs and enhanced performance for a smoother experience.

plugins.name: Babel Translations
plugins.description:
The plugin uses DeepL API to automatically translate nodes or screens in Figma. v1.0


Prerequisites

Free version of DeepL API has a limitation of 500.000 symbols which you can translate, the plugin provides you an option to use your own subscription plan (Free, Pro or Enterprise) by providing an AuthKey during the onboarding process.


Supported Features

  • Free for all. You don't pay for the plugin itself as well as for basic version of DeepL, but I would be happy if you would like to buy me a coffee.
  • Translate one or multiple selected *visible* nodes including their children.
  • Use "formality" option to translate to a more formal or informal language.
  • Use "Auto" option to automatically detect the language of the text to translate from.
  • Automatically saves the language you were translating 'from' and 'to', to speedup the process.
  • Ignore certain Text nodes by adding a keyword `:babel_ignore:` to their name.
  • Handles errors gracefully.
  • Handles loss of connection gracefully.


Roadmap

Version 1.0 of the plugin covers only necessary features for an effective translation workflow, but we are using the plugin internally at BearMinds and we see many features which would make it even better.

  • Keep styles of the original text.
  1. bold, italic, underline
  2. font size
  3. font family
  4. color
  • Option to ignore certain group of nodes when translating.
  • split_sentences option to sets whether the translation engine should first split the input into sentences
  • tag_handling option to support html and xml tags
  • preserve_formatting option to preserve formatting of the original text, even if it would usually correct some aspects.
  • ignore_tags option to ensure that elements in the original text are not altered in the translation (e.g., trademarks, product names)
  • Detect that component is selected and warn about potential breaking changes propagation.
  • Translate a lot of text at once (e.g. 10000x symbols)


Feedback

We would be happy to hear about your experience with the plugin, missing features or issues. Just write to hello@bearminds.com.
plugins.tagline: Speed up processes by automatically translating components using the power of the DeepL
